title: Job Openings at Rimdinado International Limited
content:
Rimdinado International Limited - We are a global brand, leveraging on technology and changing business conditions to provide cutting edge solutions to our communities.We provide human capital management,Organizational design and development and business process management consulting services for our wide range local and international clientele.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Head, Internal Audit

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Mortgage Bank

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The candidate is responsible to the Audit committee of the Board. He/she is charged with the mandate to ensure quarterly audit of and report on all activities of Mortgage Bank in accordance with acceptable audit standards and approved audit procedures.


Key Performance


	Professionalism and integrity
	Deadline oriented. Dependability, requiring minimum supervision
	Strong leadership and people management skills
	Sound strategic thinking, with risk and control consciousness
	Strong analytic skills
	Excellent communication skills: written and oral


Qualification & Experiences


	Bachelor's degree or its equivalent in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics or related area of study
	8-15 years work experience in audit and internal control in banking sector essential
	At least 4 years in management position
	Professional certification in accountancy (ACA, ACCA)


Required Knowledge:


	Possession of extensive experience in auditing, and a thorough understanding of Microfinance Banking and accounting practices
	Experienced in strategic planning and management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: rimdinado@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Medical Laboratory Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Pathology Laboratory
Reports To: Head of Laboratory Operations

Position Summary


	The Medical Laboratory Manager is responsible for the overall management, coordination, and supervision of laboratory operations to ensure high standards of quality, efficiency, and compliance.
	This role combines leadership with hands-on technical expertise to oversee daily operations, manage personnel, maintain accreditation standards, and ensure timely and accurate diagnostic results.


Key Responsibilities
Operational Management:


	Oversee daily laboratory operations across all departments (e.g., histopathology, microbiology, hematology, cytology, etc.)
	Monitor workflow, test turnaround times, and resource utilization to ensure optimal performance.


Quality & Compliance:


	Maintain compliance with relevant national and international accreditation standards (e.g., MLSCN, local health authorities).
	Conduct regular audits and coordinate corrective and preventive actions (CAPA).


Personnel Management:


	Supervise, mentor, and schedule laboratory scientist, technicians, and support staff.
	Foster a culture of safety, accuracy, accountability, and continuous improvement.


Administrative & Financial:


	Prepare operational reports, KPIs, and data analyses for senior management.
	Support IT system usage for LIS (Laboratory Information System) optimization.


Strategic Development:


	Support the implementation of new technologies and tests.
	Participate in planning for laboratory expansion, digital pathology, or automation initiatives.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Medical Laboratory Science BMLS or related fields (required).
	7 - 9 years of clinical laboratory experience, including at least 4/5 years in a leadership or supervisory role.
	Master’s Degree in Laboratory Management, Healthcare Administration, or related field (preferred).
	Certification/Registration with relevant professional body (e.g., MLSCN , etc.).


Skills and Competencies:


	In-depth knowledge of laboratory processes, quality standards, and regulatory compliance.
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency with LIS and data analysis tools.
	Ability to lead teams, resolve conflicts, and drive process improvements.
	High attention to detail with strong decision-making capabilities.


Working Conditions:


	Full-time, on-site with potential for extended hours as needed.
	Exposure to biohazardous materials; adherence to all safety protocols is required.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV, a cover letter detailing relevant experience, and contact information for at least two professional references to: rimdinado@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Operations Lead Job at SterlingPRO Business Application Limited
content:
SterlingPRO Business Application Limited is a FINTECH that provides innovative, market-relevant and industrialized technology consulting solutions that drive high performance in the financial sector primarily. SterlingPRO is a global brand servicing Top Commercial Banks across Nigeria and Africa with plans to expand into other markets like the U.S, Europe and Asia.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Lead

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The team is looking for an individual with a strong background in FinTech, Business Operations, and/or experience in a startup environment. In this role, you'll be working alongside the Managing Partner.
	This role is essential for driving organizational efficiency, supporting governance, and maintaining operational integrity.
	Assist the Managing Partner in managing daily business operations to ensure efficiency and alignment with organizational goals;
	Serve as the point of contact for operational issues, ensuring timely resolution in accordance with company standards;
	Oversee project coordination and initiatives, ensuring objectives are met within set timelines;
	Conduct regular reviews of business policies and processes to ensure alignment with industry best practices and regulatory standards.
	Ensuring Regulatory Compliance.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to facilitate the seamless execution of business processes;
	Monitor and evaluate key operational metrics to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions;
	Develop and maintain operational workflows, policies, and procedures to enhance efficiency and productivity;
	Monitor changes in regulatory policies and ensure timely updates and adherence to new requirements in collaboration with relevant team.
	Reporting and Strategic Planning Support.
	Support the Country Manager in developing and executing strategic plans for market expansion, business growth, and operational excellence.
	Analyze trends and data to provide actionable insights that support strategic decision-making.
	Contribute to the preparation of presentations, proposals, and business cases for stakeholders and regulators.
	Analyze financial data to identify areas for cost reduction and profit improvement.
	Identify new business opportunities and develop plans to expand the company’s market presence.
	Collaborate with department heads to set performance goals and monitor progress.
	Build and maintain relationships with clients, suppliers, and other stakeholders.
	Lead and mentor staff to improve productivity, engagement, and overall performance.
	Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide insights to drive continuous improvement.
	Negotiate contracts with vendors, suppliers, and business partners to ensure favorable terms.
	Manage and resolve any operational challenges that may arise.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Law, or a related field.
	3 - 5 years of experience in business operations, compliance, or risk management within a regulated industry.
	A master’s Degree or professional certification in Compliance or Risk Management is an advantage.
	Experience in the Fintech Sector will be a huge advantage.
	Proficiency in English, both in speaking and writing.
	Strong organizational and project management skills.
	Good analytical skills, ability to collaborate effectively, and team spirit.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels.
	Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@sterlingprong.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Restaurant Liaison Officer Job at FoodOnline Limited
content:
FoodOnline is a dynamic food delivery and logistics tech company revolutionizing how Nigerians access meals. It connects users to their favorite restaurants and food vendors through a fast, user-friendly mobile app.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Liaison Officer
Job Locations: Jabi, Utako, Wuye, Wuse, Mabushi - Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Join FoodOnline and help us deliver food faster and smarter!
	We’re looking for smart, young, and organized individuals who can work with restaurants to ensure fast and correct orders.


Your Role


	Receive order screenshot.
	Buy and confirm food from restaurant.
	Label, seal, and hand over to the assigned rider.
	Communicate delays or issues to the team.


Requirements


	Minimum of an SSCE (WAEC, NECO, or equivalent).
	Must be at least 16 years old.
	Must live in or near Jabi, Utako, Wuye, Wuse, or Mabushi.
	Polite, smart, and presentable.
	Own a smartphone with WhatsApp.
	Knows how to move fast and communicate clearly.


Salary & Benefits


	Salary: N70,000 / Month.
	Bonus tied to performance.
	Growth opportunity in a fast-moving company.
	On-the-job training.

title: Warehouse / Store Officer (Pharm Tech) Job at Castville Solutions
content:
Castville Solutions is a recruitment and business solutions provider specializing in the healthcare sector. We focus on connecting healthcare facilities with highly skilled professionals, enabling efficient operations, and driving business growth. Our services extend to recruitment, Templates for process and operations management, SOP development, and healthcare-specific training, with a clear mission to transform the healthcare workforce and operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse / Store Officer (Pharm Tech)

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Receive, inspect, and store pharmaceutical products and medical supplies
	Maintain accurate inventory records using stock management systems
	Issue and record stock movement in line with prescriptions and requisitions
	Liaise with procurement and pharmacy teams for stock replenishment
	Ensure proper storage conditions, labeling, and shelf-life monitoring
	Conduct routine stock checks and report discrepancies promptly
	Maintain cleanliness and organization of the store/warehouse area.


Requirements


	Certified Pharmacy Technician (PCN registration is an advantage)
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a pharmacy, warehouse, or medical store role
	Strong attention to detail and good record-keeping skills
	Proficiency in inventory software and basic computer use
	Ability to work independently and manage time effectively
	Strong ethics, integrity, and reliability


Salary
N120,000 - N170,000 Monthly.

 

Note: For More Information or Enquiries: Call or WhatsApp: 09010634633.
